comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://itainews.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fitainews.com%2F) ### Comment > 数週間前からlivedoor Blogを利用したサイトでスクリーンショットの赤丸の箇所に広告が表示されるようになり、ここ数日は広告の所にスクリーンショットのような広告が表示されるようになってます。 > > スクリーンショットのサイトは「https://itainews.com/」ですが、下記のサイト > http://blog.esuteru.com/ > http://jin115.com/ > http://blog.livedoor.jp/kinisoku/ > でも頻繁に表示されるようになってるので、特定のサイトで広告が表示されるのではなく、livedoor Blogを利用したサイトで広告が表示されるようになったのだと思います。 > またlivedoor Blogを利用してるサイトで昨日まで広告非表示だったのに本日から発生してるサイトがあったりと、突然表示されるようになってるサイトが増えてきてます。 > Username: `@ミャチ` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/f2o5n3qk5v4sk4g8w04sc0o8k8ws8o0j5e5ii61cgo.jpg?nc=1)

issue.title: www.hetzner.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.hetzner.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hetzner.com%2F) ### Comment > I'm trying to set my country on Hetzner via scriptlet but it seems the scriptlet is buggy. > > `hetzner.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-set-cookie-reload','__Secure-Hetzner_CountryCode','ot')` adds the cookie but it gets overridden by default setting (DE) while > `hetzner.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-set-cookie-reload','__Secure-Hetzner_CountryCode','ot')` causes a reload loop on the website. > > Meanwhile, the rule > hetzner.com##+js(trusted-set-cookie, __Secure-Hetzner_CountryCode, ot) > has no issue setting country with ublock origin extension. The same rule can be parsed by Adguard for Mac but it has the same problem. > > BTW. Adguard for Mac does not highlight syntax error if there's an error in user rules. Is there a way for Adguard to highlight errors when it detects any syntax issue? > > Thanks ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.hetzner.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hetzner.com%2F) ### Comment > I'm trying to set my country on Hetzner via scriptlet but it seems the scriptlet is buggy. > > `hetzner.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-set-cookie-reload','__Secure-Hetzner_CountryCode','ot')` adds the cookie but it gets overridden by default setting (DE) while > `hetzner.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-set-cookie-reload','__Secure-Hetzner_CountryCode','ot')` causes a reload loop on the website. > > Meanwhile, the rule > hetzner.com##+js(trusted-set-cookie, __Secure-Hetzner_CountryCode, ot) > has no issue setting country with ublock origin extension. The same rule can be parsed by Adguard for Mac but it has the same problem. > > BTW. Adguard for Mac does not highlight syntax error if there's an error in user rules. Is there a way for Adguard to highlight errors when it detects any syntax issue? > > Thanks ### Screenshots

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/187095#issue-2484587857 - Reported it here - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/Scriptlets/issues/448
As a workaround you can use this rule:
```adblock
hetzner.com#%#document.cookie='__Secure-Hetzner_CountryCode=ot; path=/; secure;';
```

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/187095#issuecomment-2314304388 - I cannot reproduce it (it's closed automatically on my end).

The same rule can be parsed by Adguard for Mac but it has the same problem. > > BTW. Adguard for Mac does not highlight syntax error if there's an error in user rules. Is there a way for Adguard to highlight errors when it detects any syntax issue? > > Thanks ### Screenshots

comment.body:
I can reproduce it with `EasyList Czech and Slovak` filter list enabled after refreshing website few times.
This rule:
```adblock
$cookie=kolbda,domain=idnes.cz
```
seems to fix it on my end.
I will add it soon.

comment.body:
Не повторяется.
Попробуйте очистить данные браузера, обновить фильтры (подождите около одной минуты), затем откройте сайт.
Если это не поможет, вам следует повторно включить блокировщики контента (веб расширения) в настройках Safari (подождите примерно столько же времени, сколько и при обновлении фильтров).
В противном случае нужно будет связаться с support@adguard.com.

@stevenya97 iOS does not provide an ability to use all rules like on desktops or in Android.
Advanced Protection - our workaround - in some cases may apply the rules too late (race condition).
AdGuard for another platforms also blocks this ad without any problems.
iOS is the worst platform for ad blockers.

On my device I can't reproduce it.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://open.spotify.com/playlist/30ItA1hHyulAM5zsJnQuL4](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopen.spotify.com%2Fplaylist%2F30ItA1hHyulAM5zsJnQuL4) ### Comment > on spotify, the ad will not play and cannot be skipped. Adguard used to just block ads, now it blocks their content, not their existence. The ads are there, but they can't be played or skipped. I have to close the browser and restart spotify to escape the loop. ### Screenshots

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/178790

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

@@ -5,6 +5,11 @@
 ! Bad: .org/ads/$domain=example.org (for instance, should be in speficic.txt)
 !
 !
+! server-side GTM pattern B ex. https://load.ss.esade.edu/ykpgwaiz.js?st=5V4W3ZR
+!+ NOT_PLATFORM(ios, ext_safari)
+/\/\/([0-9a-z]+\.){1,}[0-9a-z]+\.[a-z]{2,}\/[a-z]{8}\.js\?st=[0-9A-Z]{6,8}$/$script,~third-party,match-case
+!+ PLATFORM(ios, ext_safari)
+/\/\/([0-9a-z]+\.)?[0-9a-z]+\.[0-9a-z]+\.[a-z][a-z]+\/[a-z]{8}\.js\?st=[0-9A-Z][0-9A-Z][0-9A-Z][0-9A-Z][0-9A-Z][0-9A-Z][0-9A-Z]$/$script,~third-party,match-case
comment.body:
`{8}` missed.
Cannot find a site with such tracker, but in the main safari tab this rule works only without `script` modifier (`document` in safari dev tools)
`/\/\/([0-9a-z]+\.)?[0-9a-z]+\.[0-9a-z]+\.[a-z][a-z]+\/[a-z][a-z][a-z][a-z][a-z][a-z][a-z][a-z]\.js\?st=[0-9A-Z][0-9A-Z][0-9A-Z][0-9A-Z][0-9A-Z][0-9A-Z][0-9A-Z]$/$~third-party,match-case`
replaced `{8}` by 8x `[0-9A-Z]`
